channel.title: Which laptop is better?
channel.description:
[url=http://www.pcworld.co.uk/gbuk/laptops-netbooks/laptops/laptops/asus-n56vb-s3181h-15-6-laptop-21837020-pdt.html?sPageInfo=1_20&sSortInfo=price-desc]ASUS N56VB-S3181H[/url] or [url=http://www.pcworld.co.uk/gbuk/laptops-netbooks/laptops/laptops/acer-aspire-e1-572-15-6-laptop-21712969-pdt.html?sPageInfo=1_20&sSortInfo=price-desc]ACER Aspire E1-572[/url].
Which laptop is better? I want to be doing a bit of gaming (nothing super intensive) and school stuff on it.

item.title: Which laptop is better?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

The Asus looks hot ;p

Read full topic

item.title: Which laptop is better?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

whatever you do, stray away from acer. they’re only good if they’re free. but if you’re spending the money, don’t bother.

Read full topic

item.title: Which laptop is better?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Justin Bieber:

If £200 isn’t a massive deal then go for the ASUS. It’s definitely a lot better than the Acer. Also, I just remembered that Acer are shit.

Yeah, whilst it’s £200 I’d rather spend £200 now than later on when I have to replace it.

Read full topic

item.title: Which laptop is better?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:2, topic:542739”]Taking a shot in the dark, I don’t know too much about hardware.
Did some quick Google work, here’s a comparison for the processor http://cpuboss.com/cpus/Intel-Core-i7-4700MQ-vs-Intel-Core-i7-3630QM

The ACER is cheaper but doesn’t say anything about the graphics card, which is important if you’re going to be playing games. The ASUS has more RAM which is important for sharing the usage around different programs, good for video editing, photoshop etc. Forgive me if I’m not using the right terms.[/quote]

I plan to use the laptop for 5 years or so so a £200 difference is fairly negligible. I’d also like it to have good specs so that it will still be usable in years to come.

Justin Bieber:

The cheaper one only has two cores rather than four (+lower clock rate), but it’s still a more modern processor so probably better value for money. The TDP is also only 15W which keeps power consumption down. The gfx are also more modern, but again have a lower base frequency. I’m always tempted to go for newer tech as it’s usually better value…

So do you think that the ASUS is the wisest choice?

Read full topic
